question.text: The complex ion that will lose its crystal field stabilization energy upon oxidation of metal to +3 state is:

options.text: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mfenced open="[" close="]" separators="|"><mrow><mi>Ni</mi><msub><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">h</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi></mrow></mfenced><mn>3</mn></msub></mrow></mfenced><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math>

<math><msup><mrow><mfenced open="[" close="]" separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><msub><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">h</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math>

<math><msup><mrow><mfenced open="[" close="]" separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><msub><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">h</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math>

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mfenced open="[" close="]" separators="|"><mrow><mi>Zn</mi><msub><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">h</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi></mrow></mfenced><mn>3</mn></msub></mrow></mfenced><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math>

solution.text:
Fe+2Ar3d6→Fe+3Ar3d5

CFSE=6×-0.4Δ0=-2.4Δ0
CFSE=-2.0 Δ0

In all other cases, the electron is removed from eg orbital and is hence, this will lead to decrease in pairing energy.
